description: Number of rods required to make a 3-D cube of side length n.
formula: a(n) = 3*n*(n+1)^2. - Neven Juric (neven.juric(AT)apis-it.hr), Sep 28 2005a(n) = a(n-1) + 9n^2 + 3n. O.g.f.: (6x^2+12x)/(1-x)^4. E.g.f.: 3x*exp(x)*(x^2+5x+4). - _Geoffrey Critzer_, May 17 2009a(n) = A117227(n^3). - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 19 2013a(n) = for n>0 sum[2*(n+1)(k+n+1) {0<k<n+1}] which is the sum of all perimeters of Pythagorean triangles with arms 2*k*(n+1) and (n+1)^2 - k^2 with hypotenuse k^2 + (n+1)^2. - _J. M. Bergot_, May 12 2014
example: A 1 X 1 X 1 cube requires 12 rods.
